subject: Real Estate
title: The Domesday Book
description: A quick, practical guide to The Domesday Book.

hook.text: In 1086, William the Conqueror ordered every piece of English land counted and recorded.

buildup.text: Royal commissioners visited every village, listing who owned what, how many plows, and how many sheep.

discovery.text: The survey covered 13,418 settlements. It was the most detailed census Europe had ever seen.

twist.text: People called it 'Domesday' because its judgments were final â€” like the Day of Judgment.

climax.text: The book let William tax every acre precisely. Knowledge of land meant control of wealth.

punchline.text: England's first property database fit in one book.

quiz.question: Why was the Domesday Book created?
options: To catalog every landholding for taxation
